name.text: Simply supported beams. Finding reaction forces. Level 1

questiontext.text:
A simply supported beam of length 110 cm is shown in the figure above. There are two reaction forces, R1 and R2, one at either end of the beam. There is an external force of 15 N acting at a point 47 cm from point A.

By resolving forces and taking moments about A, determine the magnitude of reaction forces, R1 and R2.

Write your answer correct to 2 d.p.

R1 = {1:NUMERICAL:= 8.59:0.01#Good job!~%0%*#Sorry. Try again.} N

R2 = {1:NUMERICAL:= 6.41:0.01#Good job!~%0%*#Sorry. Try again.} N

generalfeedback.text:
Remember that when resolving forces, the sum of the upward forces must be equal to the sum of the downward forces.

For a system in equilibrium, the sum of the clockwise moments must be equal to the sum of the anticlockwise moments.

For a system in equilibrium, the sum of the clockwise moments must be equal to the sum of the anticlockwise moments.
